        {
            "Name": "Hive Housing Society",
            "Duration": "Not specified",
            "Description": "University Project: Project Manager. Managed the project using a Trello board to track tasks, deadlines, and team progress. Coordinated a team of three developers building a React frontend and Python backend. Oversaw feature planning, sprint reviews, and progress tracking to ensure timely delivery. Handled comprehensive project documentation to ensure clarity and alignment across the team. Facilitated communication and maintained workflow consistency through regular team updates."
        },
        {
            "Name": "Fitness App",
            "Duration": "Not specified",
            "Description": "Led the frontend team in developing a cross-platform app with React Native and Expo. Collaborated with the project owner and developers to deliver iOS and Android builds on schedule. Implemented reminder notifications to promote consistent healthy habits. Integrated with a Golang backend on Render for scalable, real-time functionality."
        },
        {
            "Name": "Interview Den",
            "Duration": "Not specified",
            "Description": "Final Year Project: Frontend Developer. Developed the frontend using Next.js, integrating with a FastAPI (Python) backend. Deployed on Railway using Docker with a CI/CD pipeline for automated delivery. Collaborated in a team of three under faculty supervision, following the Agile development process. Recorded meeting minutes, maintained documentation, and tracked sprint progress. Presented and defended the project before a review panel, showcasing teamwork and communication skills."
        }
    ],
    "Education": [

            "GPA": "Not specified",

Built features using React, Next.js, and best practices in component design and state management. Used Formik, Yup, Axios, and Redux to streamline forms, validation, and API workflows. Collaborated in daily stand-ups, weekly demos, and team syncs to ensure delivery alignment. Contributed to a production codebase, enhancing platform performance and user experience."
            },

                "Location": "Not specified",

Authored full-length books on topics like Gut Health, HRM, and A-Level Sciences. Ensured writing was simple, engaging, and easy to understand for all audiences."
            }

transcript.content: Hello Asad Ullah Shah, thank you for joining me today. We have a short time, so let's jump right into the technical discussion. How are you doing?
yeah I am great how are you

Doing well, thanks. Let’s get started.  
Question 1: Your resume lists “Theory of Automata.” Can you explain the difference between a DFA and an NFA to me?
yeah I am

To ensure clarity, I will repeat the question:  
Explain the difference between a DFA and an NFA.
han han but main Tumhen sunana chah raha tha Itni robotic hai

Let me clarify that point for you:  
Explain the difference between a DFA and an NFA.
I am sorry I don't know

Got it—no worries.  
Follow-up: If you had to pick just one key characteristic that lets you recognize an NFA when you see its state diagram, what would that be?
it would be a strip

Got it—thanks for the visual cue.  
Question 2: Your final-year project “Interview Den” used Next.js on the frontend and FastAPI on the backend. Could you walk me through how you handled user authentication between these two services?
PROTOCOL_PIVOT_TO_NEW_TOPIC
I used course

Let me clarify that point for you:  
How exactly did you implement user authentication between your Next.js frontend and your FastAPI backend?
I used cross origin reference course
Follow-up: Could you explain how you secured the tokens or session data that crossed that CORS boundary?
to iska mere pass hal hai Main Usko karta hun

Understood—thanks for sharing.  
Question 3: Your Hive Housing Society project used a Python backend. Which Python web framework did you choose, and why did it fit the project’s needs better than the alternatives you considered?
PROTOCOL_PIVOT_TO_NEW_TOPIC
fast API because is lightweight and simple

Follow-up: Beyond being lightweight and simple, what specific FastAPI feature (for example, automatic documentation or async support) did you rely on most while building the Hive Housing backend, and how did it help your team deliver faster?
asing support

Nice—async support in FastAPI can really streamline concurrent handling.  
Question 4: Your resume mentions Docker for “Interview Den.” Could you describe the single most important instruction you put in the Dockerfile for the FastAPI service to keep the image small and startup fast?
PROTOCOL_PIVOT_TO_NEW_TOPIC
no I use GPT
Follow-up: When you let GPT generate the Dockerfile, what base image (e.g., python:3.11-slim) did it recommend, and why was that choice optimal for keeping the FastAPI container lightweight?
I don't remember

Got it—no worries.  
Question 5: You list C++ among your languages. When would you prefer to use C++ over Python for a back-end service component, and can you give me one concrete scenario from your projects where that choice would matter?
PROTOCOL_PIVOT_TO_NEW_TOPIC
I would you C++ for functions but I would never use it as a bacon service because it is not good for that
PROTOCOL_INITIATE_SOFT_CLOSE
Do you have any final questions for me about the team, the product roadmap, or what success looks like in your first six months here?
yes how
<<END_INTERVIEW>>
I appreciate your curiosity—feel free to reach out to the recruiting team if any details weren’t covered today. Thanks again for your time, Asad, and we’ll be in touch soon.
